result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew M. Bickwermert

records.addlTxt:
2:22 PM Attorney Daniel Joseph Tombasco in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Matthew M. Bickwermert in court.  Attorney Zachary Caley appears on behalf of Attorney Alyssah M Foster in court for Matthew M. Bickwermert. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: Victim rights compliance. The State is requesting an adjournment in about 2 rotations to further investigate and review some concerns brought to his attention by Attorney Foster. Court adjourns.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.

09:05 AM  Attorney Dan Tombasco appeared for the State. Defendant, Matthew M. Bickwermert, appeared with Attorney Alyssah M Foster.  Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES:  Victim rights compliance. Attorney Foster is requesting adjournment as she was just appointed to this case and needs to review discovery with the DE. The State does not object. Court adjourns.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.
re: Judicial Rotation mailed to DE

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
Continued posted. 
  *No Weapons especially firearms.   No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: Nelda F, Mario C

03:21 PM   State appeared by Attorney Drew Lehman.  Defendant appeared in court in person.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  The Court finds probable cause in this case today.  Def. is referred to the Public Defender.  If not eligible, def. to retain his own counsel. Court date will not be adjourned due to def.'s failure to retain counsel.  Not guilty plea entered by court on behalf of DE. Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 01:40 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 09:00 am. $150  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry). rb
and witness list filed by the State
